Activist claims that Abujhmad encounter was fake, four children injured - Hindustan Times
summary:
Activist Claims Abujhmad Encounter Was Fake; Four Children Injured

Date: Recent

Source: Hindustan Times

Activists and villagers in Abujhmad allege that seven individuals killed by police were not Maoists but local villagers, with four children injured during the incident.

  • Activists claim that five of the seven killed were villagers working in fields.
  • Four children sustained serious injuries and reportedly did not receive medical help for three days.
  • Police deny the claims, stating that the children were used as human shields by Maoists.
  • The incident occurred in the villages of Kummam and Lekawada under Rekhawaya Panchayat, Narayanpur district.
  • Human rights activists express concern over the ongoing incidents affecting tribal children in the region.
“The deaths and injuries of tribal children in this ongoing campaign by security forces in Bastar should alarm the nation.” - Rinchin, Human Rights Activist

The incident has raised serious concerns over police conduct and the safety of villagers in the ongoing conflict with Maoists.
newTitle: Activist Claims Abujhmad Encounter Was Fake; Four Children Injured

title: Two soldiers die while loading ammunition during training exercise in Bikaner - Hindustan Times
summary:
Tragic Incident Claims Lives of Two Soldiers During Training in Bikaner

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Two soldiers of the Indian Army tragically died due to an explosion while loading ammunition during a training exercise in Bikaner.

  • The incident occurred at Mahajan field firing range.
  • A sudden explosion happened as soldiers were loading ammunition, resulting in two fatalities and one serious injury.
  • The deceased soldiers are Ashutosh Mishra from Deoria and Jitendra from Dausa.
  • This marks the second fatal incident in the Bikaner range within days.
  • A court of inquiry has been initiated to investigate the cause of the explosion.
“The charger exploded while the soldiers were loading the ammunition,” said the defence spokesperson.

This sad occurrence highlights the risks associated with military training exercises and has led to renewed calls for safety measures.
newTitle: Tragic Incident Claims Lives of Two Soldiers During Training in Bikaner

title: Amit Shah’s comment on Ambedkar: This disrespect has crossed all limits of tolerance, says Uddhav Thackeray - The Hindu
Breaking | Umar Khalid Gets 7 Days Interim Bail In Delhi Riots Larger Conspiracy Case - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Umar Khalid Granted 7 Days Interim Bail in Delhi Riots Case

Publication Date: January 3, 2025   Source: Indian Courts

A Delhi Court has granted interim bail to Umar Khalid for a week, allowing him to attend a family wedding amidst allegations related to the 2020 North-East Delhi riots. The bail comes with several conditions aimed at ensuring compliance during this period.

  • The bail is valid for 7 days.
  • Khalid must not contact any witness or individuals connected to the case.
  • He is prohibited from using social media during this timeframe.
  • Meetings are restricted to family and friends, and he must remain at home or wedding venues.

Khalid is required to surrender by the evening of January 3, 2025. His previous bail application had been rejected, leading to ongoing legal proceedings.
newTitle: Umar Khalid Granted 7 Days Interim Bail in Delhi Riots Case

title: ‘Courts doors always open’: Supreme Court on protesting farmers refusing talks with Punjab govt panel - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Courts doors always open’: Supreme Court on protesting farmers refusing talks with Punjab govt panel

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court affirmed that its doors are open to the protesting farmers after they rejected discussions with a Punjab government committee.

  • The court emphasized that farmers can directly present their demands.
  • The Punjab government reported ongoing efforts to engage with farmer leaders.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a key farmer leader, is on a hunger strike, pressing for a legal guarantee of Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
  • The Supreme Court noted the health concerns of Dallewal and instructed medical assistance from the Punjab government.
“We clarify that court's doors are always open to any suggestion or demand by farmers directly or through their authorised representative.”

This situation highlights the ongoing tension between the Punjab farmers and the state government, with the Supreme Court offering a potential avenue for resolution.
newTitle: Supreme Court Offers Support to Protesting Farmers Amidst Negotiation Challenges

title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to be part of simultaneous polls JPC: Sources - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to join JPC for simultaneous polls

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress party leaders are expected to participate in a Joint Parliamentary Committee to evaluate the introduction of legislation for simultaneous elections.

  • Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and other Congress MPs are likely to represent the party.
  • The bills concerning simultaneous elections were introduced in Lok Sabha after significant debate.
  • Opposition groups have expressed concerns, labeling the legislation as anti-constitutional.
  • Support for the legislation comes from 32 political parties, while 15 oppose it.
  • Amit Shah announced that the bill would be handed over to a JPC for further discussion.
“It is against the federalism of our nation. We are opposing the bill,” said Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

The deliberations in the JPC will be vital as the government aims to push through the simultaneous election legislation amid differing opinions within the political landscape.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to join JPC for simultaneous polls

title: Arvind Kejriwal announces new health scheme for Delhi's elderly population - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Introduces Health Scheme for Elderly in Delhi Ahead of Elections

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, the national convener of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), announced a new health scheme called 'Sanjeevani Yojana' for elderly citizens in Delhi, promising free treatment in government and private hospitals.

  • The scheme is aimed at citizens over 60 years old.
  • There will be no upper limit on the cost of treatment.
  • Registration will begin shortly with AAP workers assisting at home.
  • The scheme will be implemented once AAP wins the upcoming elections.
“There are a lot of errors in the central government's scheme and Delhi government has launched a better scheme correcting those errors,” said Delhi Minister Saurabh Bhardwaj.

This announcement follows a face-off with the BJP regarding the implementation of the Central government's Aayushmaan Bharat scheme.

In conclusion, this move is part of AAP's strategy to capitalize on healthcare issues ahead of elections, promising enhanced support for seniors.
newTitle: Kejriwal Introduces Health Scheme for Elderly in Delhi Ahead of Elections

Parliament Winter Session Day 19 LIVE Updates: Both Houses adjourned for the day amid major ruckus over Amit Shah’s remarks on BR Ambedkar - The Indian Express
summary:
Parliament Winter Session Day 19 LIVE Updates: Both Houses adjourned for the day amid major ruckus over Amit Shah’s remarks on BR Ambedkar

Date: December 13, 2024
Source: Indian Express

Just minutes after proceedings resumed, both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha were adjourned for the day amid ruckus over Amit Shah’s statements on Dr BR Ambedkar. The Congress party criticized the introduction of the ‘One Nation One Election’ bills in the Lok Sabha.

  • The 'One Nation One Election' Bill was introduced amid backlash, with 269 MPs voting in favor despite opposition claiming it was unconstitutional.
  • Amit Shah targeted the Congress party for its historical constitutional amendments, contrasting them with the BJP’s record.
  • The Constitution debate concluded, highlighting issues affecting backward classes and Muslim women.
“The Congress party has not worked for the welfare of backward classes,” - Amit Shah.

This session exemplifies the ongoing tensions in the Indian Parliament over key legislative changes and historical grievances.
newTitle: Parliament Winter Session Day 19: Major Ruckus Over Amit Shah's Remarks

title: Priyanka Gandhi To Be Part Of House Panel On 'One Nation, One Poll': Sources - NDTV
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi To Be Part Of House Panel On 'One Nation, One Poll': Sources

Date: November 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Priyanka Gandhi and Manish Tewari are nominated to study the 'one nation, one election' Constitution Amendment Bill, which proposes simultaneous elections in India.

  • Priyanka Gandhi and Manish Tewari are among Congress nominees for the panel.
  • The bill was introduced amid opposition protests regarding its implications on federalism.
  • The BJP is likely to lead the committee, which will consist of a maximum of 31 members.
  • The panel has an initial period of 90 days to submit its report.
  • The Constitution amendment proposes changes to allow simultaneous federal and state elections.
“This move directly challenges the federal nature of the country... by imposing uniformity across states.” - Manish Tewari

The upcoming committee discussions are crucial as they will address concerns about the federal structure and the integrity of diverse state elections in India.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Joins House Panel for 'One Nation, One Poll'

title: PM Modi supports Amit Shah, says ‘Congress’s lies cannot hide its insults to Ambedkar, our reverence for him absolute’ - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Defends Amit Shah Against Congress Insults to Ambedkar

Published: December 18, 2024 02:13 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

In a robust defense of Amit Shah, Prime Minister Modi refuted Congress' claims of insults to B.R. Ambedkar, asserting that Shah exposed the party’s historical disrespect towards the Constitution’s architect.

  • Modi emphasized that Congress is trying to obscure their history of insults to Ambedkar.
  • The Prime Minister accused the Congress of using theatrics to distract from the facts presented by Shah.
  • Mr. Modi mentioned the longstanding issues faced by Ambedkar’s legacy under Congress rule.
  • He cited various government initiatives that align with Ambedkar's vision for social justice.
  • Protests occurred in both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha related to the controversy.
“They can try as they want but they can't deny that the worst massacres against SC/ST Communities have happened under their regimes.” - PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks highlight ongoing tensions between the BJP and Congress, focusing particularly on historical narratives surrounding prominent leaders like Ambedkar.
newTitle: PM Modi Defends Amit Shah Against Congress Insults to Ambedkar

Punjab rail roko protest begins; here are the affected routes - The Tribune India
summary:
Punjab Farmers Begin Rail Roko Protest Over MSP Demands

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: The Tribune

Farmers in Punjab have initiated a protest by halting train services to demand a legal guarantee for the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for crops. This protest follows previous clashes between farmers and police in Haryana.

  • Protesting farmers are focused on halting train traffic from 12 noon to 3 PM.
  • Past confrontations included the use of teargas and water cannons by police.
  • Farmers are advised to assemble at local railway stations.
“We urge farmers to avoid isolated tracks and protest in their local areas,” said farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher.

This protest is expected to cause significant inconvenience for passengers traveling through the affected areas.
newTitle: Punjab Farmers Begin Rail Roko Protest Over MSP Demands

Parliament session LIVE: Both houses adjourned till 2pm amid row over Amit Shah's remarks - Hindustan Times
summary:
Parliament session LIVE: Both houses adjourned till 2pm amid row over Amit Shah's remarks

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parliament session has been adjourned amid a dispute over Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar. The Congress party has demanded an apology for what they argue are disrespectful remarks.

  • Both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha have been adjourned till 2pm during the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament.
  • The Congress party criticized Amit Shah's remarks made during a parliamentary debate and called for his resignation.
  • Several bills are being considered, including those related to the representation of Scheduled Tribes in Goa and the regulation of oilfields.
“He has insulted Baba Saheb Ambedkar and the Constitution.” - Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress MP

The disruption in the Parliament highlights tensions between the ruling party and the opposition following controversial statements regarding a key figure in Indian history, BR Ambedkar.
newTitle: Parliament session LIVE: Both houses adjourned till 2pm amid row over Amit Shah's remarks

title: Chaos in Gaur City 2: Woman slaps 6-year-old after dispute between 2 kids, faces FIR - The Times of India
summary:
Chaos in Gaur City 2: Woman Slaps 6-Year-Old After Dispute Between Kids

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

In a shocking incident in Gaur City 2, a woman has been accused of slapping a 6-year-old child following a dispute between two kids. This altercation has prompted authorities to file a First Information Report (FIR) against the woman involved.

  • The incident took place after a disagreement escalated between children playing in the area.
  • Witnesses report that the woman acted irrationally, leading to the confrontation.
  • The FIR filed marks a significant response from local authorities regarding child safety and community conduct.
“Such behavior is unacceptable, and we will not tolerate any harm done to children in our community.” - Local Authority

This event highlights the importance of resolving conflicts amicably and the need for protective measures for children in local communities.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink being used in Manipur? SpaceX founder answers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Elon Musk Responds to Starlink Use in Manipur Amid Violence

Dec 18, 2024 - Hindustan Times

SpaceX founder Elon Musk addressed claims that Starlink satellite internet was being utilized amidst the ongoing violence in Manipur.

  • Musk stated that Starlink satellite beams are turned off in India.
  • Security forces seized internet devices, including a satellite antenna and router, during a raid in Imphal East.
  • Recent violence in Manipur stemmed from ethnic clashes that began on May 3, 2023.
“This is false. Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India.” - Elon Musk

The situation in Manipur continues to escalate, with ethnic divisions leading to ongoing unrest and violence.
newTitle: Elon Musk Responds to Starlink Use in Manipur Amid Violence

Pune Boy, "Influenced By Social Media", Sexually Assaults 3-Year-Old Girl - NDTV
summary:
Nine-Year-Old Boy Allegedly Sexually Assaults Three-Year-Old Girl in Pune

Date & Source: Published by NDTV

Introduction: A nine-year-old boy in Pune has been detained for allegedly sexually assaulting a three-year-old girl. The boy claimed to have been influenced by social media.

  1. The boy and the girl's families are long-time residents of the same neighborhood.
  2. The boy is a Class III student at a local school, and the girl used to call him 'dada' or 'elder brother'.
  3. The alleged assault took place near the girl's home.
  4. The girl informed her mother about the incident, who then alerted the police.
  5. Charges have been filed under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act and the new criminal laws.
The boy claimed to have been influenced by social media.

Conclusion: The incident highlights the potential influence of social media on young minds and the importance of parental supervision.
newTitle: Nine-Year-Old Boy Allegedly Sexually Assaults Three-Year-Old Girl in Pune

J&K: Former DSP among 6 killed after fire breaks out at house in Kathua - Hindustan Times
summary:
Tragic Fire in Kathua Claims Six Lives Including Former DSP

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A significant fire incident occurred in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua district, leading to the tragic deaths of six individuals, including a former deputy superintendent of police and his young grandson. The fire broke out in the early hours, with locals discovering it around 2:30 AM.

  • The deceased include Avtar Krishen Raina, 81, former DSP, and his 3-year-old grandson.
  • Four others were injured and are receiving treatment at the Government Medical College in Kathua.
  • Preliminary investigations indicate that victims died from smoke inhalation.
  • Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed his condolences on social media.
  • The police have initiated an investigation into the incident.
“Deeply shocked to learn about the accidental death of 6 members of a family resulting from fire incident in the Shiv Nagar area of Kathua city.” - Jitendra Singh

This unfortunate incident has highlighted serious concerns regarding fire safety and the urgent need for better awareness in residential areas.
newTitle: Tragic Fire in Kathua Claims Six Lives Including Former DSP

title: 'Satellite beams turned off over India': Elon Musk rejects claim Starlink being used in Manipur - Deccan Herald
summary:
Satellite beams turned off over India: Elon Musk rejects claim Starlink being used in Manipur

Published: 18 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

In response to accusations of Starlink satellite technology being used in the conflict-ridden state of Manipur, Elon Musk clarified that no Starlink beams are operational over India.

  • Security forces seized internet devices along with arms during a raid in Keirao Khunou.
  • Photos of seized items included a device with the Starlink logo, leading to speculation about its use.
  • Musk stated on Twitter, "This is false. Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India."
  • The seized items included a satellite antenna, router, and cables.
  • Investigation underway to determine how these devices reached Manipur.
  • Starlink does not have a license to operate in India.
  • Manipur has experienced ethnic violence resulting in over 250 deaths since May 2023.
This is false. Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India.

Elon Musk's response highlights the ongoing concerns regarding the use of technology in conflict areas and raises questions about the accessibility of satellite services in regions experiencing strife.
newTitle: Elon Musk Denies Starlink Usage in Manipur Amid Controversy

summary:

This article discusses the recent meeting between India's National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, where both parties expressed readiness to strengthen bilateral relations.

  • Ajit Doval and Wang Yi held discussions on various strategic issues between India and China.
  • Beijing emphasized its willingness to collaborate and improve ties with India.

“We are ready to work with India on mutual interests,” said Wang Yi during the meeting.
